newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico's peso closes with big gains against dollar.
newsitem.headline: Mexico's peso closes with big gains against dollar.

text.p: Mexico's peso bounced back from recent losses on Monday as players unwound long dollar positions following President Ernesto Zedillo's state of the nation address on Sunday.
But dealers said trade was very thin due to the U.S. market holiday.
"The peso gained because some banks undid their long positions on the dollar, but there was very little action," one dealer said.
The peso ended up 3.9 centavos to 7.5360/7.5410 and 7.54/7.5450 per dollar, respectively.
Dealers said some banks took long positions on Sunday to hedge against any surprise announcements in the yearly address.
There was no same-day trade due to the U.S. holiday.
U.S. economic data due out on Tuesday could put pressure on U.S. interest rates and hurt the peso, dealers said.
